sentences.english: We must admit that your unwearied effort is in some measure successful.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须承认你们不屈不挠的的努力多少是成功的。

sentences.english: He is endowed with indomitable will.
It is hard to bear up under affliction.
sentences.chinese: 受尽折磨仍不屈不挠是很不容易的。

sentences.english: The original fragile flowers ah, but it has an indomitable spirit.
sentences.chinese: 这些原本娇弱的花朵啊，却有着不屈不挠的精神。

sentences.english: A great man is one who has a strong will and an indomitable spirit.
sentences.chinese: 一个大人物是一个具有坚强意志和不屈不挠精神的人。

sentences.english: It is built on the unhampered initiative.
sentences.chinese: 它是建立在不屈不挠的进取精神之上的。
成功属于不屈不挠的人。

sentences.english: He always applies himself wholeheartedly and indefatigably to the tasks given him.
sentences.chinese: 给他的任务他总是全心全意不屈不挠地去完成。

sentences.english: The relief workers kept soldiering on.
sentences.chinese: 救援人员“不屈不挠”地继续工作。

sentences.english: His dauntless fortitude makes him absolutely fearless.
sentences.chinese: 他不屈不挠的坚韧让他绝无恐惧。

sentences.english: But I still drive to perform the full duty, indomitable.
sentences.chinese: 但我仍然劲头十足地履行天职，不屈不挠。

sentences.english: He is a fighter with an unconquerable will.
sentences.chinese: 他是个有著不屈不挠意志的斗士。
人的精神就是不屈不挠的。

sentences.english: The fight against TB demands the determination and tenacity of all of us.
sentences.chinese: 对结核的斗争需要我们大家有不屈不挠的决心。

sentences.english: Tough means that you are willing to stand tall and persevere.
sentences.chinese: 顽强不屈意味着你愿意不屈不挠地坚持下去。
他是不屈不挠的改革者的典型。

definition: to keep on fighting in spite of all setbacks (idiom)/to be undaunted by repeated setbacks/to be indomitable
firm and indomitable (idiom); tenacious and unyielding
see 百折不撓|百折不挠[bai3 zhe2 bu4 nao2]
not to submit to force (idiom); to defy threats and violence
to chip away at a task and not abandon it (idiom); to chisel away at sth/to persevere/unflagging efforts
to persevere unremittingly (idiom); to keep going until the end
